The Dangers Of Prescription Drug Errors

More and more prescription drugs today offer relief to so many of us who suffer an ever-growing range of medical conditions. But if they are not prescribed properly or with caution, injury and death can result.

Common Types Of Medical Errors

Some of the common medication errors that harm patients include:

  • Overmedication
  • Under Medication
  • Wrong medication
  • Anesthesia errors
  • Failing to note harmful combinations of drugs
  • Failure to monitor the effects of medication

The result of these medication errors can include:

  • Liver damage
  • Kidney damage
  • Stopped breathing

Do You Suspect Your Injury Was Caused By Your Medication?

Hospitals, clinics and pharmacists have a duty to patients to make sure they properly prescribe these medications and offer information about the risks associated.

If you suspect your injury was caused by your prescription drug, reach out to a legal professional immediately. Hospitals and clinics are rarely forthcoming with information that will indicate any error on their part. Uncovering the truth needs skilled legal representation.

Protecting The Rights Of The Injured Since 1968

At Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, our attorneys have been handling medical malpractice and other personal injury cases for individuals in Ohio for 50 years.

We pursue medication error cases against all involved parties, including:

  • Physicians
  • Nurses
  • Pharmacies
  • Hospitals
  • Clinics

We are skilled at investigating theses cases, bringing the truth to light and creating accountability in order to recover full compensation for the injuries you sustained.

Extensive Medical Knowledge

In addition to more than 20 years of experience as an attorney, Kathy A. Dougherty has 15 years of past medical experience working in various roles in hospitals and clinics. This experience is invaluable in analyzing the often voluminous evidence that is a part of a medical malpractice case.
